name: Hawkins, Indiana
description: A small, seemingly ordinary town in Indiana that became the epicenter of supernatural events connected to the Upside Down. Home to Hawkins National Laboratory and the main characters.
significance: Main setting of the entire series
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Vanishing of Will Byers

name: The Upside Down
description: A dark, toxic mirror dimension that exists parallel to our world. It's covered in organic matter, perpetual darkness, and floating particles. Home to the Demogorgon, Mind Flayer, and other creatures.
significance: Origin of all supernatural threats in the series
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Vanishing of Will Byers

name: Hawkins National Laboratory
description: A secret government research facility run by the Department of Energy. Dr. Martin Brenner conducted experiments on children with psychic abilities here, including Eleven.
significance: Where Eleven was raised and the first gate was opened
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Vanishing of Will Byers

name: Byers House
description: The modest home of Joyce, Jonathan, and Will Byers. Featured the famous Christmas lights communication system Joyce used to contact Will in the Upside Down.
significance: Key location for early supernatural discoveries
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Vanishing of Will Byers

name: Wheeler House
description: The two-story home of the Wheeler family - Ted, Karen, Nancy, Mike, and Holly. The basement served as The Party's headquarters and where Eleven first hid.
significance: Meeting place for The Party and safe haven for Eleven
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Vanishing of Will Byers

name: Starcourt Mall
description: A large shopping mall that opened in Hawkins in 1985. Beneath it, the Soviet Union built a secret facility to open a new gate to the Upside Down.
significance: Site of the Battle of Starcourt and Soviet secret base
first_appearance: Chapter One: Suzie, Do You Copy?

name: Hawkins Middle School
description: The middle school attended by The Party. Features the AV Club room where Mr. Clarke mentors the kids and where supernatural investigations often took place.
significance: Where The Party solves mysteries and the Snow Ball dance occurred
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Vanishing of Will Byers

name: Hawkins High School
description: The high school where Nancy, Jonathan, Steve, and later The Party attended. Home of the Tiger basketball team and the Hellfire Club.
significance: Location of Hellfire Club meetings and where Vecna's curse began
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Vanishing of Will Byers

name: Hopper's Cabin
description: A secluded cabin in the woods where Chief Hopper hid Eleven for nearly a year. It became their home and a safe space away from danger.
significance: Eleven's hiding place and home with Hopper
first_appearance: Chapter One: MADMAX

name: The Creel House
description: A Victorian-style house where the Creel family lived in 1959. Henry Creel murdered his family here using his powers. It became Vecna's anchor point in Hawkins.
significance: Origin of Vecna and gateway between dimensions
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Hellfire Club

name: Scoops Ahoy
description: An ice cream parlor inside Starcourt Mall where Steve and Robin worked. They discovered the Soviet secret base from this location.
significance: Where Steve and Robin discovered the Soviet conspiracy
first_appearance: Chapter One: Suzie, Do You Copy?

name: Family Video
description: A video rental store where Steve and Robin work after Starcourt Mall was destroyed. Located in downtown Hawkins.
significance: Steve and Robin's workplace in Season 4
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Hellfire Club

name: Kamchatka Prison
description: A Soviet prison complex in Kamchatka, Russia where Hopper was held captive. The Soviets experimented with Upside Down creatures and a captured Demogorgon here.
significance: Where Hopper was imprisoned and fought the Demogorgon
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Hellfire Club

name: Hawkins Community Pool
description: The town's public swimming pool where Billy Hargrove worked as a lifeguard. The Mind Flayer used the pool's chemical room for his early operations.
significance: Where Billy was possessed by the Mind Flayer
first_appearance: Chapter One: Suzie, Do You Copy?

name: Lenora Hills, California
description: A town in California where the Byers family and Eleven moved after the Battle of Starcourt. Eleven attended Lenora Hills High School here.
significance: Byers family's new home in Season 4
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Hellfire Club

name: The Void
description: A black, water-covered mental plane where Eleven can project her consciousness to locate and observe people across vast distances.
significance: Eleven's psychic projection space
first_appearance: Chapter One: The Vanishing of Will Byers

name: Palace Arcade
description: A video game arcade in Hawkins where The Party spent time and where Max earned her 'MadMax' high score on Dig Dug.
significance: Where The Party met Max
first_appearance: Chapter One: MADMAX

name: Murray's Bunker
description: Conspiracy theorist Murray Bauman's heavily fortified bunker home in Illinois. Served as a safe house for the group on multiple occasions.
significance: Safe house and planning location
first_appearance: Chapter Six: The Spy

name: Pennhurst Mental Hospital
description: A psychiatric hospital where Victor Creel was institutionalized after being wrongly blamed for his family's murders committed by his son Henry.
significance: Where Nancy and Robin interviewed Victor Creel
first_appearance: Chapter Two: Vecna's Curse

name: Skull Rock
description: A distinctive rock formation in the Hawkins woods that resembles a skull. Used as a meeting point by the kids.
significance: Meeting location in Season 4
first_appearance: Chapter Five: The Nina Project
